{"step_by_step_thinking": "The dorsal interossei muscles are located in the hand and are responsible for abduction of the fingers. There are four dorsal interossei muscles in total, one for each finger except the thumb. To determine which finger has two dorsal interossei, we need to identify the fingers that have two muscles. The fingers that have two muscles are the ones that can perform abduction. The muscles responsible for abduction are the dorsal interossei. Therefore, the finger that has two dorsal interossei is the one that can perform abduction. Based on this information, the answer is the index finger.", "answer_choice": "D"}
